Row.NAME: eccentric orbit
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The planet or belt has a noticeably elliptical orbit around its star, leading to strong variations of illumination and weather if there is an atmosphere
Row.DEST_TEXT: "The orbit has stablilized and is now in line with the rest of the system."

Row.NAME: weak magnetosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The weak planetary magnetic field is not strong enough to deflect highly energetic solar radiation. Ionizing particles can thus wreak havoc on living organisms on the planet
Row.DEST_TEXT: "The magnetosphere appears to have returned to normal. This will make the planet more eco-friendly."

Row.NAME: strong magnetosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The strong planetary magnetic field is intense enough to shield living organisms from dangerous ionizing particles coming from the sun or other stellar objects
Row.DEST_TEXT: "The magnetosphere appears to have returned to normal. This will make the planet more eco-friendly."

Row.NAME: chaotic axis
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The axial tilt of the planet is not stable. Instead, it varies slowly but that change induces a cascade of perturbations both in seasonal illumination and weather pattern
Row.DEST_TEXT: "The planet's axis has been restored to a more normal cycle. This will improve the bio of this planet."

Row.NAME: high axis tilt
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The high obliquity of the planet's rotation axis leads to very long seasons and very slow day-night cycles. The climate is thus much harsher on this world
Row.DEST_TEXT: "The planet's axis has been restored to a more normal cycle. This will improve the bio of this planet."

Row.NAME: very quick rotation
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The planet rotates very quickly, so fast the planet has a significant equatorial bulge. Very short days and gravitational variations make living harder on this world
Row.DEST_TEXT: THE PLANET'S ROTATION HAS BEEN DECREASED SLIGHTLY.

Row.NAME: quick rotation
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The planet rotates quickly, thus featuring short days that disturb human endocrine sleep cycles
Row.DEST_TEXT: THE PLANET'S ROTATION HAS BEEN DECREASED SLIGHTLY.

Row.NAME: slow rotation
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The planet rotates very slowly, leading to very long days and harsh seasons and climactic phenomenon
Row.DEST_TEXT: THE PLANET'S ROTATION HAS BEEN SPED UP, ALIGNING THE DAYS TO THE REST OF THE SYSTEM.

Row.NAME: toxic soil
Row.TRAIT_DESC: There are many compounds toxic to our biology present in this planet's top soil
Row.DEST_TEXT: THE PLANET'S SOIL, THROUGH BACKBREAKING TERRAFORMING, HAS BEED MODIFIED TO A MORE NORMAL CONDITION.

Row.NAME: meteor showers
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The planet crosses several large reservoirs of asteroids through its orbit, leading to frequent and sometimes very damaging impacts on its surface
Row.DEST_TEXT: THE PLANET HAS MOVED INTO A SAFER ORBIT, FREE (MOSTLY) FROM COMETS

Row.NAME: violent weather
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The extreme weather patterns on this world make it difficult to live or operate on
Row.DEST_TEXT: THE PLANET'S WEATHER PATTERNS HAVE MOVED TO A MORE NORMAL BASELINE. WHILE MOST RESIDENTS ARE HAPPY, STORM CHASERS ARE FORCED INTO UNEMPLOYMENT.

Row.NAME: corrosive atmosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: There is a high concentration of acids (nitric and/or sulfuric) in this planet's atmosphere
Row.DEST_TEXT: THE PLANET'S ATMOSPHERE HAS BEEN STABLILIZED AND IS MUCH LESS CORROSIVE AND DANGEROUS.

Row.NAME: explosive tectonics
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The crustal plates of this geologically active world display violent shifts and splitting. Massive eruptions and earthquakes are thus common
Row.DEST_TEXT: WITH AN INJECTION OF SUPERCOOLED HYDROGEN INTO THE CORE OF THIS PLANET, THE TECTONICS HAVE BEEN CALMED.

Row.NAME: very active tectonics
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world is geologically very active, with many crustal rifts and subduction zones. Alas, that leads to frequent earthquakes and eruptions
Row.DEST_TEXT: WITH AN INJECTION OF SUPERCOOLED HYDROGEN INTO THE CORE OF THIS PLANET, THE TECTONICS HAVE BEEN CALMED.

Row.NAME: vestigial life
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world had evolved its own limited biosphere. Most has unfortunately disappeared, and only some specimen remain in the soil or ice, in semi-dormant state
Row.DEST_TEXT: WE HAVE PORED OVER THE REMAINING LIFE, AND LEARNED ALL WE CAN LEARN. THE LAST SPECIMEN HAS BEEN ELIMINATED.

Row.NAME: prion ecosystem
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This planet possesses a vivid and resilient ecosphere based on simple self-replicating proteins that wreak havoc in our metabolism, poisoning animals and plants alike
Row.DEST_TEXT: WE HAVE DESTROYED THE PRION ECOSYSTEM.

Row.NAME: fossil life
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The planet used to have a full-blown biosphere with complex life-forms. Alas, it all collapsed and died out, but not before it improved the soil and ecosphere

Row.NAME: local toxic ecosystem
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world has a thriving biosphere with a twist: its building blocks are different but close yet enough to ours so that they lethally interact with our metabolism

Row.NAME: compatible ecosystem
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A rarity under the heavens, this world has a biochemically compatible ecosystem. The amino acids and peptides can be fully absorbed by man without harm

Row.NAME: local super organism
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This planet is covered by one of very few colossal living entities, neither plant nor mushroom. This life-form has changed the climate and even the soil of the planet

Row.NAME: very rare materials
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Unlikely rare earths and metal deposits are located in the crust of the planet

Row.NAME: rich lithosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Some unknown process has stopped the heaviest materials from sinking towards the core of the planet during its formation. The planet's crust is hence very rich in minerals

Row.NAME: differentiated lithosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A prolonged molten state of the planet during its very early life has lead to most of its heavy elements sinking towards the core. The crust is now poorer in minerals

Row.NAME: metal nodules
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Incomprehensible geological processes have lead to the creation of spherical pure metal nodules. They are just waiting to be harvested

Row.NAME: extinct civilization
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Once an alien civilization flourished here. Today nothing remains, not even the slightest scrap of life, only skeletons and derelict structures

Row.NAME: explosive winds
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Complex wind currents and Coriolis forces lead to common very high-speed winds that can move or pulverize rock

Row.NAME: fertile soil
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The topsoil of this world contains nitrates and other compounds that make it very suitable for growing earth-like food

Row.NAME: bacterio-static soil
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The soil of the planet contains metal compounds that inhibit the grown of earth-originated bacteria, severely hindering agriculture and creating health issues

Row.NAME: clement micro-climates
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Some locations on this world are more privileged than others, and feature a better climate than the rest of the planet

Row.NAME: radioactive soil
Row.TRAIT_DESC: High concentrations of radioactive isotopes of potassium and radium are present in the topsoil of the planet

Row.NAME: tide-locked to sun
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The planet's rotation period has synchronized with the rotation around the parent star. Thus the same face is always turned towards the sun, leading to extreme climate

Row.NAME: very eccentric orbit
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The orbit of the planet is very elliptical, bringing the planet very close and/or very far from its sun. This leads to extreme variations of illumination and climate

Row.NAME: magnetic pole inversion
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The planet currently undergoes an inversion of its magnetic field, leaving huge areas unprotected from radiation as the polar magnetic gap moves across the surface

Row.NAME: freak tides
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Every once-in-a-while, the moons of this planet are aligned so that a monstruous tide sweeps the surface of the planet

Row.NAME: hard radiation
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The gaps in the radiation belt of the planet leave its surface open to very highly energetic particles

Row.NAME: very hard radiation
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The non-existent magnetosphere and atmospheric protective layer do not provide any protection on the surface against cosmic and stellar radiation

Row.NAME: mineral mesas
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Huge underground mineral-rich formations riddle the crust of the planet

Row.NAME: deep water pockets
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Very ancient fossil water is trapped between layers of rock

Row.NAME: polar water deposits
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Massive amounts of water exist near the poles, either locked in soil as permafrost or in ice deposits

Row.NAME: stratospheric air wells
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Cyclonic systems sometimes provoke down-welling of very cold upper-atmosphere air down to the surface. These air wells can lead to mini-glaciation episodes

Row.NAME: geothermal activity
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The intricate mixing of water and lava flows in the crust lead to explosive water volcanism on the surface

Row.NAME: permafrost ground
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Notable quantities of water are locked in frozen soil just beneath the surface

Row.NAME: vitrified topsoil
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A not well understood geological process has led to vast swathes of the surface becoming vitrified (mostly silicates)

Row.NAME: high gravity
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The high density of the planet leads to a higher-than-usual gravity on the surface. This can be stressful to the living creatures originated from Earth

Row.NAME: very high gravity
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The very high density of this world makes for a high gravity at the surface. Not only is this exhausting to our known life-forms, but it also hinders production

Row.NAME: water scarcity
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world suffers from a paucity of water on its surface and below, making it harder to colonize

Row.NAME: abiotic fossile fuel
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Uncommon geological processes have given birth to pockets of natural gas trapped in underground pockets

Row.NAME: dense atmosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world has kept most of the gas released from its crust, leading to a thick atmosphere

Row.NAME: active volcanism
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Volcanoes and rifts riddle the surface of this world

Row.NAME: absence of water
Row.TRAIT_DESC: For a host of inter-connected reasons, water is almost non-existent on this planet. This greatly affects how habitable the world can be to us

Row.NAME: hydrogen-poor
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The surface of this world as well as its atmosphere suffer from a lack in lighter elements such as hydrogen and helium

Row.NAME: uranium rich
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Unexpected deposits of uranium and thorium are located on this planet

Row.NAME: bacterial fossil fuel
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A now defunct type of local bacteria created vast underground lakes of hydrocarbon. These can be processed through and produce energy

Row.NAME: heavy metals in topsoil
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Nickel, arsenic and cadmium are all present at high concentrations in the topsoil of the planet. This complicates the task of any human colony

Row.NAME: chaotic seasons
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The particular seasonal patterns of this planet make it impossible to forecast its weather. This is especially unfortunate since the seasons here are of great amplitude

Row.NAME: very dense atmosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The atmosphere on this world is so dense it may almost considered liquid. All human activities are greatly affected by this

Row.NAME: freak weather patterns
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Unpredictable and devastating atmospheric phenomena such as hyper-storms frequently blast the surface of this world

Row.NAME: invasive micro-dust
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Very fine dust will invade everything and find its way through into every machinery. It will causes silicosis and mechanical malfunctions alike

Row.NAME: hostile nano-machines
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Virus-sized machines of unknown origin will attack any life-form or machine that sets foot on the surface

Row.NAME: Xyl artifacts
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The Xyl once visited this world and left a few debris testifying to their fleeting presence

Row.NAME: Xeno-fragments
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A very different alien specie once traveled to this world or belt, and left some scattered remnants of its presence

Row.NAME: unstable surface
Row.TRAIT_DESC: On most of this world, the surface is half-fluid or unsettled. It is hard to find great expanses that will not suffer repeated landslides or sinkholes

Row.NAME: close tidal system
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world has a very large moon orbiting around. Strong tides deform ice and land and greatly move liquid masses if there is any

Row.NAME: hollow crust
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Interactions with fluids lead to a great part of the planet's crust being riddled with tunnels and galleries

Row.NAME: strong magnetic field
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The rotating liquid core of the planet generates a strong magnetic field

Row.NAME: fierce magnetic field
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Interaction between central layers of the planet and its core generate a very strong magnetic field around the planet

Row.NAME: old Xyl colony
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The Xyl once had a settlement on this world, but abandoned it a while ago. No-one wants to live here

Row.NAME: world-wrecking tides
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This planet has a particularly large moon near its Roche limit, generating humongous tides across its surface

Row.NAME: thin atmosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This giant's atmosphere is unusually thin, most of the volatile gases having been lost to space

Row.NAME: large ice core
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Lack of heavy materials during the creation of the planet has led to a largely ice-silicates core. The magnetic field of the planet is thus much less strong than usual

Row.NAME: slow hydrogen core
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The liquid metal hydrogen core rotates very slowly, and does not generate a strong magnetic field as with most other giants

Row.NAME: partially solidified core
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Presence of water and silicates in the core inhibit the formation of a large hydrogen core, this avoiding the strong magnetic field so deadly to life

Row.NAME: water-silicate mantle
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The high proportion of ice and silicates in the mantle of this giant lead to the existence of a pseudo-surface

Row.NAME: slow atmospheric cells
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The upper and medium layers of this giant feature unusually slow winds

Row.NAME: methane islands
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Frozen islands of methane float in the intermediate layers of the atmosphere

Row.NAME: solid cloud banks
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Carbonic and frozen sulfate ice banks float in the medium-lower atmospheric layers of this giant planet

Row.NAME: still air cells
Row.TRAIT_DESC: There are on this planet some atmospheric bands with little or no velocity

Row.NAME: calm atmospheric layers
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Sandwiched between high-speed currents, the planet features an intermediate layer with very moderate winds

Row.NAME: viscous liquid surface
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Unlike most other giants, this planet has enough water to sport a viscous frozen high-pressure surface

Row.NAME: fractal structures
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The particular environment of this world allow huge fractal methane and sodium ice structures to form and propagate across its atmosphere

Row.NAME: hydrogen polyps
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This planet is infested with the ubiquitous Hydrogen Polyp. This incredible creature can breathe hydrogen and resist hard vacuum

Row.NAME: hydrogen medusas
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This giant planet is a shelter to the endangered hydrogen medusa -a vulnerable and incredible life-form

Row.NAME: methane-rich
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world features a high concentration of methane in its atmosphere

Row.NAME: methane-saturated
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The levels of methane on this world are so high that breathing is a hazardous affair without a full envi-suit

Row.NAME: oxygen-rich atmosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: High levels of oxygen are present in this planet's atmosphere. Fire hazards are more dangerous

Row.NAME: sulfide-rich atmosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The atmosphere around this planet is rich with sulfur compounds of volcanic origin

Row.NAME: electrostatic clouds
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The clouds around this world are electrically charged

Row.NAME: large electric storms
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world suffers from long lasting and strong electrical storms

Row.NAME: storm season
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Several times a year, climate cycles overlap and generate planet-wide storms that engulf most of its surface

Row.NAME: abrasive sand storms
Row.TRAIT_DESC: On this waterless world, sharp sand crystals blown by powerful winds are strong enough to carve mountains in days

Row.NAME: giant magma chambers
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world has large pockets of lava beneath its surface, waiting to find a way up to the surface

Row.NAME: new crustal rift
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This geologically very active world has just given birth to a new crustal plate, pouring out hot magma on a massive scale

Row.NAME: hot-spot chain
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Deep crust faults let the mantle's hot magma up-well to the surface, creating chains of active volcanoes

Row.NAME: recent collision debris
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This belt is riddled with fast-moving little debris due to a collision between two of its largest components

Row.NAME: wake of collision
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This belt is experiencing a host of medium secondary collisions because a large celestial body crossed through it some time ago

Row.NAME: recent volcanic chain
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A new string of large dome volcanoes has appeared on the surface of its planet, with many lava outpourings and geothermal activity

Row.NAME: water-poor crust
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The crust of this planet is not lubricated enough by water, so it creates endless earthquakes and strange topographical features

Row.NAME: cryo-volcanism
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Warm ice finds its way through the ice crust and erupts instantly, creating large ice domes. Geothermal spots provide heat and water for human settlements

Row.NAME: solar wind deposits
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Helium and hydrogen isotopes have been deposited on the surface of the planet by the solar wind. The deuterium, tritium and helium 3 atoms are ideal fusion reactor fuel

Row.NAME: deep impact bassin
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A large meteor smashed the surface of this world, creating a deep crater with its own micro-climate. It is the perfect spot for a settlement

Row.NAME: deep crust ridges
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Huge and deep ridges have opened on the planet because of the dilation of the mantle. Such gorges provide ideal shelter and easy access to some energy sources

Row.NAME: metal-rich regolith
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The regolith on this world or belt is particularly rich in metals such as aluminum, titanium and iron

Row.NAME: metal-poor regolith
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The surface of the planet or belt is made of regolith that lacks the usual metal oxides

Row.NAME: Ice-shelf tectonics
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The icy surface of the world is warmed enough so that it mimics plate tectonics of the rocky planets, only with ice sheets

Row.NAME: warm ice upwelling
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Numerous funnels conveying warm ice from the mantle create small oasis around which colonies might grow

Row.NAME: captured Kuiper objects
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This ice belt contains several large ice-silicates planetoids originated from the Kuiper belt

Row.NAME: nickel-iron asteroids
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This asteroid belt features some exceptionally large nickel-iron asteroids. They might be remains from a large collision in another part of the solar system

Row.NAME: polymetal asteroids
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Some unusually large metal asteroids can be found in this asteroid belt

Row.NAME: hostile organism
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A continent-scale living creature delves on this world, and it is not happy to shelter any of our colonies

Row.NAME: benevolent organism
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A humongous life-form covers part of this planet. It has shown to be cooperative and open to symbiosis with humans.... so far

Row.NAME: organism bloom
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The colossal life-form living on this world is going through a sort of reproduction cycle. It is changing water currents, air circulation patters and causes earthquakes

Row.NAME: mineral pseudo-plankton
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Small mineral self-replicating lifeforms live in the waters here, creating large structures resilient to waves and perfect for colony building

Row.NAME: strong currents
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Saline convection and thermoclines create extremely fast currents that hinder settlement operations

Row.NAME: underwater caves
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Just below the surface of this world lie large cavities filled with saline water

Row.NAME: migrating islands
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Large islands made up from light volcanic rock drift across the vast expanses of this watery world

Row.NAME: radiophile void plankton
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This planet has been colonized by the void plankton, an incredibly resilient fluoride-based lifeform that thrives in hard-radiation

Row.NAME: freak underwater tides
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This watery world is among the few to have such powerful underwater back-and-forth currents

Row.NAME: underwater volcanoes
Row.TRAIT_DESC: That ocean-covered world is seething under the surface, covered with innumerable undersea volcanoes that spit their noxious fumes day and night

Row.NAME: shallow volcanic vents
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Giant lava funnels have shaped the bottom of the ocean, and formed lagunas where ecosystems can thrive. Methane and nutrients abound

Row.NAME: strong seasonal winds
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Strong winds will blow across the surface of this planet, hard enough to rip off most human installations

Row.NAME: dimensional ghouls
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Mysterious and ghastly creatures appear and disappear mysteriously here. Sometimes they look like grossly deformed men, other times like Xyls

Row.NAME: sanctuary planet
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This alien-controlled world is strangely alive, but we cannot pinpoint any precise lifeform. It obeys a strange set of rules and will reject our presence on given occasions

Row.NAME: labyrinth planet
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This planet is a giant labyrinth, its old yet still functional empty cities full of dangers and deadly traps. No one has seen any occupants nor understood anything about this world

Row.NAME: resonant mega waves
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Sometimes, inexplicably titanic waves sweep the surface of this world, making it barely possible to have any land

Row.NAME: methane clathrates
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Located within the seabed, there are large deposits of such gas. It will burn fiercely, providing moderate but very cheap energy

Row.NAME: hydrophobic lifeforms
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This desert world hosts strange lifeforms that breathe sulfur and hydrogen. Water is toxic to them and they attack anything with water, including humans

Row.NAME: tide-covered archipelago
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The surface of this ocean planet hosts extensive chains of islands that provide shelter from the waves. Unfortunately, they are still underwater when the tide comes

Row.NAME: pseudo-coral reefs
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A local specie of proto-cells coagulate together and form towering cliffs above the sea bed. Those reefs are high enough to rise above the surface of the sea

Row.NAME: fissile material nodes
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Radioactive isotope deposits abound on this world. Their formation is still unexplained

Row.NAME: heavy water wells
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Deep pockets of deuterium-rich water are located on this planet. Deuterium is a good fusion fuel

Row.NAME: warm ice pockets
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Deep within the icy crust of this world are domes filled with warm ice

Row.NAME: deep crust cracks
Row.TRAIT_DESC: When this world grew colder, its surface cracked open and almost revealed its mantle. Those very deep gorges offer interesting settings for settlements

Row.NAME: Sub-ice water ocean
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Underneath the icy crust of this world lies a warm water ocean, warmed up by radioactive decay

Row.NAME: deep hydrocarbon lakes
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Pockets of hydrocarbon are located just below the surface of this frozen world

Row.NAME: Sub-ice hot water cells
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Hot water near the core of the planet ascends through the mantle and sometimes finds its way up the very surface

Row.NAME: Sub-ice volcanism
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Boiling water and methane gas erupt through vents and create towering showers of debris

Row.NAME: tidal-stress heating
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The influence of other celestial objects along this planet's orbit move the core around, generating heat and melting of its water-silicate mantle

Row.NAME: broken terrain
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This planet has a surface broken and smashed because of its formation process

Row.NAME: very rugged surface
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Most areas covering this world are made up of ridges, gorges and cliffs

Row.NAME: featureless surface
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Geological activity or erosion have erased most features of this planet, filling the ridges and smoothing out the surface

Row.NAME: rough surface formations
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Uplifting of the crust and volcanic activity have broken up the surface into rough cliffs and mountains

Row.NAME: very loose regolith
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The intense meteorite bombardment has pulverized the surface into a very thick and loose regolith layer. The layer is so thick it is almost impossible to move on

Row.NAME: very uneven topography
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A host of processes have crushed and crumbled the surface of this planet into a series of sharp points and fields of pointy rocks

Row.NAME: polar sublimation storms
Row.TRAIT_DESC: When the water or carbon dioxide ice melts at the poles, it creates huge tornadoes that engulf the planet for weeks

Row.NAME: oblique orbit
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The inclination of this planet's or belt's orbit profoundly affects its illumination or cilmate

Row.NAME: complex orbit
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world follows a rather complex and irregular orbit, due to the influence of other celestial bodies

Row.NAME: cometary reservoir
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This belt contains many captured Kuiper-belt originated comets, providing a healthy supply of water

Row.NAME: large trojan clusters
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Resonance with other celestial bodies have created stable zones where great quantities of asteroids gather. This makes it easy to move and live in this belt

Row.NAME: unstable belt
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Stellar and planetary influences lead to instabilities in this belt, with ripples and waves of collisions

Row.NAME: shepherd moons
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This belt is flanked and kept in shape by many shepherd moons. Those moons also provide a safer environment for any settlement

Row.NAME: very large planetoids
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Remnants of giant collisions have fused back into small planets. This belt is thus made up from trojan-placed clusters of both ice-rock planets and asteroids

Row.NAME: toxic shrouds
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Noxious gases are often released from vents on this world's surface

Row.NAME: rich topsoil
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A combination of volcanism and glaciations have left in the soil a rich blend of compounds ideal for agriculture

Row.NAME: year-long monsoons
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Intense water-cycles in the atmosphere lead to rain seasons that can last up to a year, drowning everything in a sea of mud

Row.NAME: hallucinogenic gases
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The unfiltered air of this world is known to cause hallucinations and spasms to oxygen-breathing life

Row.NAME: seasonal ice thinning
Row.TRAIT_DESC: When the planet is close to its perigee or its volcanic activty peaks, the ice crust thins out. This creates dangerous tracts of easily broken thin ice

Row.NAME: violent cryo-tectonics
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Warm ice from below the thin icy surface erupts and cracks open the surface in violent surges

Row.NAME: devastated world
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world or belt has apparently been bombarded into oblivion with weapons beyond our comprehension. Large tracts lay vitrified and twisted, with huge holes in the crust

Row.NAME: moons w/ atmosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: One or more large moons with thick atmosphere orbit around this giant planet. Their distance from the giant world means the radiation is low

Row.NAME: arid habitable moons
Row.TRAIT_DESC: One more more large and dry moons orbit this giant planet. The presence of a local magnetic field means the radiation of the mother planet is not a problem

Row.NAME: proto-earth moon
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A very large moon with its own strong magnetic field, orbits around this giant planet. Although its atmosphere is thick with methane, it is otherwise quite habitable

Row.NAME: many hospitable moons
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Many average but colony-friendly moons orbit this giant planet

Row.NAME: icy habitable moons
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A few very cold yet still habitable moons can be found around this giant planet

Row.NAME: volcanic moons
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Moons with tidal volcanism exist around this giant planet. They lack a strong magnetic field but machines can still operate on them, and extract their mineral riches

Row.NAME: irradiated moons
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Several moons orbit close to this giant planet, but they are bathed in the worlds' magnetosphere

Row.NAME: shifting sand ocean
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This arid planet is mostly covered in inhospitable seas of fine sand. That sand is unfortunately quicksand.

Row.NAME: moving dunes
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This desert world has giant mobile dunes, moved by strong winds. The dunes will swallow and crush anything in their path.

Row.NAME: thermotropic parasites
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Microscopic dwelling creatures bore through almost any material seeking heat. They will eat away metal and skin alike

Row.NAME: crystal life-forms
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Odd crystalline-structure life-forms exist on the planet, and they do not get well with our water-based biology

Row.NAME: very mild seasons
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The local environment and topography lead to a very stable succession of seasons

Row.NAME: symbiotic polyps
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Puzzling energy-matter creatures attach themselves on living entities and improve their metabolism

Row.NAME: protective atmosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The low and intermediate layers of the atmosphere provide a good protection against radiation, sheltering life

Row.NAME: frozen oasis
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Very low melting point compounds help the creation of near-hospitable frozen climactic systems

Row.NAME: oasis chains
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Many rare hospitable micro-environments exist on this world, with water and a thicker atmosphere

Row.NAME: deep water reservoirs
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Chemically-generated water reservoirs replenish themselves deep below the surface

Row.NAME: warm dark areas
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Large swathes of dark surface material allow local temperatures to rise well above sublimation point

Row.NAME: large island chain
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world's oceans and tides have not been able to erode several large island

Row.NAME: tide-resistant atolls
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Wave-line rocky formations protect encapsulated areas from waves and tides

Row.NAME: shallow lagoons
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Vast rocky plateaus exist just below the surface. Eroded by waves, they still offer good shelter

Row.NAME: miniature continents
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Untamed by strong waves and tides, several large rocky surfaces break the surface of this world

Row.NAME: thick-crust continent
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Some parts of this magmatic world have cooled enough to form a thick rocky crust

Row.NAME: volcanic cycle low
Row.TRAIT_DESC: There is a cyclic low in the volcanic activity of this planet

Row.NAME: cometary impact
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A recent cometary impact has brought water into this dry world

Row.NAME: meteorite impact
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A meteorite recently crashed into this planet, releasing materials, dusts and revealing mineral deposits

Row.NAME: massive stellar impact
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A planetoid has collided with this planet, releasing gases and dusts into a thickened atmosphere

Row.NAME: grazing stellar impact
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A large meteor has glanced off this world, ripping off a part of the crust

Row.NAME: cometary shower
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world is crossing the path of a disintegrating very large kuiper object.

Row.NAME: volcanic cycle high
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The volcanoes on this world are going through a cycle-high, releasing large amounts of gases and materials

Row.NAME: degassing episode
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Geological activity leads to vast volumes of gases finding their way into the thickening atmosphere

Row.NAME: early magnetic field
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A partially solidified metal core is generating a planetary magnetic field

Row.NAME: very stable orbit
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The orbit of that planet is both stable and perfectly circular, leading to

Row.NAME: stabilizing moon
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The moon orbiting this world is large enough to stabilize the planet's rotation axis and seasons

Row.NAME: large habitable moon
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This planet has a particularly large moon orbiting it - both a ready source of materials and potential colony

Row.NAME: polar haven
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This inhospitable world sports two hospitable spots near its poles, where water ice can be found

Row.NAME: recently acquired moon
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A large planetoid has recently been captured, but its orbit is unstable. It might collide with its parent world sometime

Row.NAME: retrograde moon
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A moon orbiting this world is in retrograde orbit, loosing altitude regularly. It will one day crash on the planet

Row.NAME: cooling oasis
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A very thick and cratered part of the crust has cooled enough to provide an unexpected safe environment

Row.NAME: tall stable plateau
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A temporary elevated part of the solidified crust gives shelter from lava and eruptions

Row.NAME: deep Faraday caves
Row.TRAIT_DESC: There are many caves with metal walls that shield from most charged particles crashing on this world

Row.NAME: deep cave network
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Deep within the crust of the planet are caves deep enough to dampen the magnetic storms of the planet

Row.NAME: thickening crust
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The volcanic activity on this world are drawing to an end, and the planetary crust has already started to solidify

Row.NAME: natural anti-magnetism
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Large geological formations contain multiple layers of metals that act as shields against particles

Row.NAME: tide-damping kelp
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This planet is host to a specie akin to coral that lives in huge floating kelp fields. They damp the tides of the waters.

Row.NAME: shallow salt fields
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Due to massive evaporation and erosion, most of the surface is made up of salty shallow marshes

Row.NAME: cold spots
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The magmatic chambers below the surface deviate and leave some spots completely free of lava outpourings

Row.NAME: volcanic atmosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The gas spurting volcanoes have created a rich sulfur-carbon dioxide atmosphere

Row.NAME: regular water cycle
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The water cycle of this planet helps regulating the weather and mitigate any violent climatic event

Row.NAME: irregular magnetosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The core dynamo generating the planet's magnetosphere is potent but has some irregularities

Row.NAME: nascent magnetosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The metal core of this planet is generating a modest yet useful magnetic field to protect the planet from ionizing radiation

Row.NAME: pulsating magnetic field
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The core of the planet is generating a magnetic field that pulses in time

Row.NAME: thick ozone layer
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This world is protected from ultra-violet radiation by a thick layer of ozone gas

Row.NAME: average ozone layer
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A layer of ozone shields this world from harmful ultra-violet light

Row.NAME: nitrogen atmosphere
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A thick nitrogen atmosphere is present around this world

Row.NAME: hydrocarbon cycle
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A whole climate system exist which uses hydrocarbons instead of water

Row.NAME: near sublimation point
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This icy world is almost warm enough to sometimes start melting and sublimating its icy surface

Row.NAME: greenhouse gas layer
Row.TRAIT_DESC: A methane-layer captures enough infra-red radiation to heat this world just below water freezing

Row.NAME: methanogen life
Row.TRAIT_DESC: This frozen world has a very dense atmosphere that hosts primitive methane-breathing life

Row.NAME: melting-point perigee
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The elliptical orbit of this world brings it close enough to the sun to cause partial melting of its ice crust

Row.NAME: radiation-low apogee
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The elliptical orbit of this world brings it far enough from the sun to lower the radiation levels for a time

Row.NAME: super-conductive surface
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The particular composition of the soil and its low temperature make natural super-conductive material abundant

Row.NAME: captured asteroids
Row.TRAIT_DESC: The planet has captured many large asteroids, giving it an edge in mining and production capacity

Row.NAME: world-dwelling eel
Row.TRAIT_DESC: Rare giant space eels nest in this area. Their burrows and droppings are very valuable, but beware of the monsters
